description: Partition triangle A008284 read from right to left.
comments: a(n,m) is the number of partitions of n with n-(m-1) parts or, equivalently, with greatest part n-(m-1).The columns are the diagonals of triangle A008284. The diagonals are the columns of the partition array p(n,m), n >= 0, m >= 1, with p(n,m) the number of partitions of n in which every part is <= m; p(0,m) := 1. For n >= 1 this array is obtained from table A026820 read as lower triangular array with extension of the rows according to p(n,m)=A000041(n) for m>n.
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, pp. 94, 96 and 307.
M. Kauers and P. Paule, The Concrete Tetrahedron, Springer 2011, p. 27.
links: H. Bottomley, Illustration of initial terms
formula: a(n, m)= A008284(n, n-(m-1)).a(n, m)= p(m-1, n-m+1), n >= m >= 1 with the p(n, m) array defined in the comment.a(n, m)=0 if n<m or m<=0 or n=0; a(1, 1)=1; a(n, m)= a(n-1, m)+a(m-1, 2*m-n+1).Viewed as a square array by antidiagonals, T(n,k) = 0 if n<0; T(n,1) = 1; otherwise T(n,k) = T(n,k-1) + T(n-k,k). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jul 25 2006
